title: Geography Challenge - Beginner
description: Basic world geography - countries, capitals, and landmarks

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France.

questions.question: Which continent is Egypt located in?
questions.explanation: Egypt is located in northeastern Africa.

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean, covering about one-third of Earth's surface.

questions.question: Which country is famous for the Great Wall?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China is one of the most famous landmarks in the world.

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.explanation: There are 7 continents: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia.

questions.question: Which river is the longest in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is generally considered the longest river in the world at about 6,650 km.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world by both area and population.

questions.question: Which mountain range contains Mount Everest?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is located in the Himalayas on the border between Nepal and Tibet.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia, located between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is technically the largest desert in the world, being a cold desert.
